Record.name: Record
Record.documentation: A record of a user's interaction event data.

properties.documentation:
A string map (key-value pair) of event-specific data that you might choose to record. For example, if a user chooses a shoe icon on your site, you might send size, brand, and color information of the shoe.

  • For all supported event types, except ListView, you send properties using key-value pairs. For example,

    {"id": "itemid1"}

    {"id": "itemid1", "name": "itemname"}

    {"brand": "nike", "size": "9", "color":"black"}

  • For the ListView event type, you use the items key with an array of objects as the value (each object having one or more key-value pairs). For example,

    {items: [{"id": "item1", "name":"value"}, {...}]}

sentAt.documentation: The timestamp on the client side when the event occurred.

context.documentation: Provides event context information as a key-value pair. For example, browser and version used.

InvalidInputException.documentation: Provide a valid value for the field or parameter.

trackingId.documentation: The tracking ID for the record in Amazon Resource Name (ARN) format. The ID is generated by a call to .

sessionId.documentation: The session ID associated with the user's visit.

eventList.documentation: A list of event data from the session.
